pr_title: Introducing flow with 2 levels of VLAN tagging on endpoints

timeline.message:
Introducing flow with 2 levels of VLAN tagging on endpoints

This change adds the ability to use 2 levels of VLAN tags on flow
endpoints.  I.e. you can define 2 (outer and inner) VLAN tags for each
flow endpoint.

Flow's endpoints (source and dest) encoding are independent, so it can
be defined as "default port" (no VLAN tags), as VLAN tagged and as QinQ
or double VLAN tagged for each end of the flow.

OF spec allow to the switch to reject flows that manipulate with
possible missing ethernet packet's field. If the OF flow's action list
contains pop VLAN tag(for example) action it must have VLAN tag match in
it's match field (see section 7.2.6 Action Structures OF specification
v1.5.1 for more details). As a result we can't do the flow's endpoint
encapsulation on egress switch as before, we need to unwrap ingress
endpoint encapsulation on egress switch and apply/wrap egress
encapsulation on egress switch.

So ingress switch will drop all(except last in case of transit-VLAN
encapsulation) VLAN tags from ethernet packet, wrap it into transit
encapsulation and on egress switch transit encapsulation will be
unwrapped and corresponding egress endpoint VLAN tags are added.

This change adds the ability to use 2 levels of VLAN tags on flow
endpoints.  I.e. you can define 2 (outer and inner) VLAN tags for each

Flow's endpoints (source and dest) encoding are independent, so it can
be defined as "default port" (no VLAN tags), as VLAN tagged and as QinQ
or double VLAN tagged for each end of the flow.

OF spec allow to the switch to reject flows that manipulate with
possible missing ethernet packet's field. If the OF flow's action list
contains pop VLAN tag(for example) action it must have VLAN tag match in
it's match field (see section 7.2.6 Action Structures OF specification
v1.5.1 for more details). As a result we can't do the flow's endpoint

encapsulation) VLAN tags from ethernet packet, wrap it into transit
encapsulation and on egress switch transit encapsulation will be
unwrapped and corresponding egress endpoint VLAN tags are added.

timeline.author: niksv

timeline.bodyText:
we have method  findByEndpointAndVlan() so you can use it instead of checking outer vlan manually
I'm not really sure about this break. Example:
you have 2 flows: common flow and one switch one port flow.
flow1 src:  sw = 1, port = 1, outer vlan = 1, inner vlan = 2
flow2 src:  sw = 1, port = 1, outer vlan = 5, inner vlan = 5
flow2 dst:  sw = 1, port = 1, outer vlan = 1, inner vlan = 3

needle will be equal to sw = 1, port = 1, outer vlan = 1
during first iteration you will add flow1 to the result
during second iteration you will compare needle with flow2 src but flow2.src.outerVlal != needle.outerClan
that is why you will break and you wouldn't compare needle with flow2.dst
Expected result: flow1 and flow2 in result
Actual Result: flow1 in result

I think you should also check src/dstMultiTableFlag for flows, because only flows which are in multiTable mode use shared rule.
timeline.author: niksv

replies.bodyText:
1 - findByEndpointAndVlan return only 1 flow (this is incorrect from what this method should do/return.
2 - fixed.
3 - fixed.
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.bodyText:
filter is a bad naming. It should be something like switchRules, expectedRules, rulesToBeInstalled, etc
filter is to general
timeline.author: niksv

timeline.bodyText: entry is a bad naming too. it must be rawCookie ot something connected with cookie
timeline.author: niksv

timeline.bodyText: I'm not very sure about naming. Why Egress? here you are checking that flow endpoint is source and path is forward. I thought such paths called ingress
timeline.author: niksv

replies.bodyText:
This path goes from source to dest i.e. it is forward path. So from the "source" flow side view, it is egress path, because it starts at the "source" side and goes somewhere else (in our case to the dest side of the flow).
Why it must be "ingress"?
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.bodyText:
You must check that flow is in multiTable mode.
Scenario:

set multiTable = false on switches
create flow with one vlan
validate src/dst switch

Expected Result:
no missing rules.
Actual Result:
missing shared rule
timeline.author: niksv

timeline.bodyText:
Here must be Ingress table.
There is a problem with priorities.
Current priorities:
Double tag 0
Single tag -10
Default Port -1

It means that Default Port will catch all single tag traffic
Default port priority must be changed.
timeline.author: niksv

timeline.bodyText:
We must NOT check that switch is in multiTable. We must check that flow endpoint in multi table
scenario:

switch is in multiTable
create flow outer vlan 1, inner vlan 0.
update switch props (multiTable=false)

Expected result:
shared rule still on switch because flow still in multiTableMode
ActualResult:
shared rules was removed. flow doesn't work
timeline.author: niksv

replies.bodyText: Why this scenario is invalid? After multi-table mode change affected flows must be updated too. Unless this moment they are invalid and must report discrepancies on validation.
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.author: niksv
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -336,6 +329,7 @@ public boolean equals(Object object) {
                 && Objects.equals(getInputPort(), that.getInputPort())
                 && Objects.equals(getOutputPort(), that.getOutputPort())
                 && Objects.equals(getInputVlanId(), that.getInputVlanId())
+                && Objects.equals(getInputInnerVlanId(), that.getInputInnerVlanId())

replies.bodyText: nice catch ... too used to lombok
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.author: niksv
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -330,7 +315,9 @@ public boolean equals(Object object) {
                 && Objects.equals(getInputPort(), that.getInputPort())
                 && Objects.equals(getOutputPort(), that.getOutputPort())
                 && Objects.equals(getInputVlanId(), that.getInputVlanId())
+                && Objects.equals(getInputInnerVlanId(), that.getInputInnerVlanId())

timeline.bodyText: (nit) As you added @getter to each field you can just add @getter to the class
timeline.author: niksv

replies.bodyText: In this case, I must remove all generic getters, it increases change size, I am not allowed to do it now.
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.author: niksv

timeline.bodyText: Can we use new RulesContext() instead of null to do new face with NPE?
timeline.author: niksv

replies.bodyText:
RulesContext() is used only in *Remove commands and only after null check i.e it is a nullable field by its design.
As for me - invalid "default" values for a nullable field can make much more damage than null.
Fixed.
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.author: niksv

timeline.bodyText:
should we also map connected devices fields in method
public abstract FlowEndpoint mapFlowEndpoint(FlowEndpointV2 input); ?
timeline.author: niksv

timeline.message:
QinQ limit capabilities

Limit QinQ capabilities - remove the ability to have QinQ and single
VLAN flows on the same port when outer VLAN matches. In exchange for
keeping existing OF flows format for single-VLAN flows in multi-table
mode.

QinQ limit capabilities

Limit QinQ capabilities - remove the ability to have QinQ and single
VLAN flows on the same port when outer VLAN matches. In exchange for
keeping existing OF flows format for single-VLAN flows in multi-table
mode.
(do-not-push) func-tests fixes stealed from test/qinq-final branch
(do-not-push) func-tests fixes stealed from test/qinq-final branch

Test/qinq final (#3466)

* Dispatch v1 flow create to flow hs

- changed worker for flow v1 create request
- fixed compile time warnings

* adjust test framework to work with list of vlans

* add QinQFlow spec

* delete duplicated test

* test traffic for vlan/default/qinq flows at the same time

* add test for issue 3472

* (func-test-incompatibility)

* (func-tests-incompatibility)

* (func-tests-incompatibility)

* add test swap endpoints qinq

* adjust connectedDevices work with qinq and add test

* update SwitchHelper(ignore shared rule)

* fix MetersSpec

* fix errorMessages in tests for APIv1
